benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to invoice item

covered: PUT - Valid Request: Multiple successful update scenarios (TC01–TC05, TC21–TC22) verify correct updates across states (no prior fields, existing fields) and payload sizes.
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: Proper 404 handling for missing items and empty DB states (TC07, TC24–TC25).
Robust Input Validation: Invalid ID format (TC06), malformed/empty body (TC08, TC10), unsupported fields (TC11), security payloads (TC14).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy present and enforced (TC01, TC03, TC09); optional headers handled (TC02).
Error Handling: Auth 401 (TC13), system errors 500 (TC15), timeout 504 (TC16), dependency outage 503 (TC19), potential 413 for large payloads (TC12).
Idempotency: Repeated same PUT yields consistent 204 and state (TC17).
Performance/Scalability: Parallel updates across many items and large single payload performance (TC20–TC21).
Edge conditions: Minimum allowed values and unexpected URL query parameter behavior (TC22–TC23).
gaps: PUT - Partial Update rule: No scenario explicitly verifies whether partial updates are rejected or allowed (e.g., updating a subset vs. full replacement semantics for custom fields).
PUT - Concurrency on same resource: No tests for race conditions or concurrent updates to the same invoice item by multiple users/requests, including last-write-wins vs. optimistic locking behavior.
Content negotiation: No test for missing/incorrect Content-Type or Accept headers (e.g., text/plain or missing Content-Type) and corresponding 415/406 handling.

Schema/data-type validation: While unsupported fields are tested, there are no scenarios for incorrect data types, invalid enum values, length constraints, or value ranges within CustomField objects resulting in 400/422.
Authorization granularity: Only 401 is covered; no test for authenticated but unauthorized user (403 Forbidden).
Audit headers validation: No tests for excessive length, illegal characters, or whitespace-only values in X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment.
Rate limiting/throttling: No scenarios to verify 429 Too Many Requests under high-frequency calls to this PUT endpoint.
Response contract: No verification of response headers on success/error (e.g., correlation IDs, content-type on error, no body for 204).
recommendations: Add scenarios to define and verify partial update behavior: one that sends a subset of custom fields and asserts either rejection (400) or the precise update semantics if allowed.
Introduce concurrency tests: two or more simultaneous PUTs to the same invoice item with different payloads; assert final state, conflict detection, or versioning/ETag-based protection if applicable.
Add content negotiation tests: wrong/missing Content-Type should return 415; unacceptable Accept header should return 406.
Expand schema validation: invalid data types (e.g., number where string expected), out-of-range lengths, invalid enum values, nulls where prohibited, duplicate keys; expect 400/422 with clear errors.
Add authorization coverage for 403 Forbidden when the user is authenticated but lacks permission to modify invoice items.
Validate audit headers rigorously: overly long values, disallowed characters, and empty/whitespace-only; ensure correct 400 validation errors.
Add rate limiting tests to confirm 429 behavior and proper Retry-After headers under burst traffic to this PUT endpoint.
Verify response headers: ensure 204 has no body; error responses include application/json content-type and diagnostic fields (e.g., error code, request id).
